Summary: This hotel is clean, has a complimentary breakfast daily, $12 parking, laundry facility, fitness center, pool and great staff! Everyone has been super friendly and knowledgeable! They also have food, drinks etc for everyone Mon-wed nights. The location is close to parks, dana point and laguna! I almost stayed at the Cliffs by Marriott and went over there to look around and yet it is pretty, it is def a resort style where there were a lot of meetings going on. The residence inn is more quaint, smoke free and pet friendly!
Manager Response: Greetings!!!!Thank you so much for the wonderful comment! We are so looking forward to host your next visit! Cheers!  Have a wonderful springtime ahead!  Warm Regards, -Grace

Summary: My wife andI stayed here last Christmas and plan to do so again this year, 2016.  The mini suites have a great bathroom/shower as well as a complete kitchen.  The large desk is useful for doing paperwork and computer at the same time.    Breakfast is included but gets an  "ok"
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Love the pet friendly environment, basketball, pool and putting green.
Summary: Location is near the freeway, so certain rooms may hear some current construction noise, but the bigger issue are the train whistles if you room faces the ocean. Staff was great, breakfast so-so, rooms very good.  Would stay here again and recommend to friends if the price was reasonable. They charge for parking, but at least no resort fee.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've gotten used to Marriott properties being clinically generic so that once you're in the front door you don't know if you're in Miami, Memphis or Modesto - so I was surprised and delighted to find the decor of this hotel echoes the old California ranch style which are the roots of San Juan Capistrano.  Artwork and colors inspired by the local area were nicely done and felt appropriate for a coastal California hotel.   Very impressed.   Lobby is nice and spacious with a variety of seating based on what you need to do, and flows on to outdoor areas with a pool, sports court, bbq area and firepit.  Again, very nicely done and taking full advantage of the great California climate.   Rooms are typical Residence Inn.  Large, well appointed, comfortable and functional.  It had a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We needed a hotel last minute over veterans weekend and found this through my search. We were surprised at the low rate and were concerned at the quality of the hotel. To our surprise, it was a wonderful choice.  The place is clean, comfortable and quaint. The staff is friendly, great breakfast choices and it is also a great location to 5 Fwy.  The room has a kitchen/living room, nice bathroom and it pet friendly (had a sign for the door that you could put out if you had pets inside)
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future visit in the area! Have a wonderful Thanksgiving celebration ahead!  Cheers! Grace & Team

Summary Heading: Great rooms and pretty close to ocean
Summary: Nice Residence Inn in the midst of a shopping area and just a mile or two from the beach. Hotel is very nice inside and rooms are big, have a kitchen and are very clean. Unfortunately the hotel charges for parking, $12 per night. I was a little surprised they charged for parking. Actually when I said I was surprised the person at the front desk was a bit rude about it. She went on to say Marriott says they need to charge for it and hotel does not own the parking lot. Way too much information and her delivery was less than professional. When I left the next morning at 5am the morning front desk person was completely the opposite, friendly, professional and went out of her way. Didn't hold lack of professionalism against the hotel when writing my review.
Manager Response: Greetings!  We trust that you are enjoying Fall –and ready for the holidays ahead!  Thank you for your feedback. Rest assured that this will be addressed on our end. The team continues to strive to be better each day – and this is a great teachable moment to share with our Frontline associates. Please accept our deep apology on this regard.  We are so looking forward to host your future visit in the area! Have a wonderful Thanksgiving ahead!  Grace & Team

Summary: This hotel was a great place to stay to visit our son at camp Pendleton.  Close to the beach and close to Capistrano.  Rooms are large with kitchens.   Breakfast is very good with lots of choices.  Close to many good restaurants.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future visit in South Orange County!  Have a wonderful Thanksgiving celebration ahead!  Cheers! -Grace & Team

Summary Heading: Pricey but Nice Place to Stay in San Juan Capistrano Area
Summary: Residence Inn is one of those extended stay places that has a full kitchen, dishwasher, fridge, microwave, dishes and silverware in each room.  Room seemed very new with King Bed, sofabed and a very nice shower (all glass standup design).  One drawback is that there seemed to be a lot of background noise - either plumbing or air conditioning or something else sounded like it would suddenly turn on and then turn off again after awhile most of the day and night.  Had small pool, jacuzzi, small basketball court, outdoor firepit and putting green onsite in addition to usual workout room.  Would give kids something to do if they had a few hours to kill sometime during the stay.  Typical Marriott where they charged $12 a day for do-it-yourself parking; not your typical free
Manager Response: Hello! It was our pleasure hosting your stay! Have wonderful holidays ahead! We would love to see you on your next trip in the area!  Cheers! Grace M

Summary Heading: Great location and really nice hotel!
Summary: We originally were booked at a different hotel on the PCH but it was substandard for our taste, BW+. We decided to relocate to this Residence Inn and what a difference Clean bright rooms nice people nice breakfast and all in all great service. The train was not really an issue for us but some light sleepers may be awaken by it,  I found it just part of the experience,  I usually stay at a Residence Inn as a first choice and Hampton or Fairfield and my 2nd and third choice, but the BW+ was a 1,star at best.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for this wonderful feedback! It was our pleasure hosting your stay! Have wonderful holidays ahead! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! Grace M

Summary Heading: Great coastal property in So. Orange County - Needs a little polish
Summary: Overall, the Residence Inn - a newer property, located less than two miles from the beach in San Juan Capistrano California. Close to the I-5 freeway and easy to access in any direction.  Overall the hotel staff was very helpful during our stay. The General Manager Grace was provided gracious service and was very responsive to my issues during my 32-night stay. The front desk staff was one of the best in the industry, especially employee Hope, a young, energetic employee always ready to provide excellent service.  I did have some issues during the stay: 1) During the early part of the stay the outdoor areas, especially by the pool entrance door & outdoor dining areas were populated by inconsiderate smokers. After a young cigar smoker sat next to us near the BBQ eating area, I
Manager Response: Greetings!  It was our pleasure meeting you and your family!! Thank you for making the hotel your second home during your stay! Rest assured that I will share your positive experience with Hope and our fantastic Front Office team!!!They are such great service driven, friendly and warm associates! We are so proud of them – on how they deliver above and beyond service!  On the Operations side – we thank you for the details that you shared. Rest assured that this will be addressed on our end. We continue to review our current processes and rise above it. The hotel truly valued your comments in improving our smoking signage. This was updated and addressed.  Wishing you and the rest of the family – wonderful holidays again! Good luck on all your new endeavors!!!!  Sincerely, Grace M

Summary: I stayed her for a night because I had an event nearby. The front desk representative noticed it was my birthday and waived the parking fee and gave me a great room. The rooms are really modern and you will be pleasantly surprised.  Great use of space.  I give it all 5's.  If I had one suggestion, turn down the radio level at the pool as it can be heard from the rooms in early morning (Im assuming its from the pool perhaps its from the neighboring mobile home community). This is a great model for future Residence Inns.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! It was our pleasure hosting your stay! We are so looking forward to see you on your next visit!  Have a wonderful week ahead!  Cheers! -Grace

Summary: We closed our week off in The Residence Inn at Dana Point. A relative new hotel with larger rooms. Good service and good quality hotel. Only downside is the very busy road next to the hotel. Rooms at front/road side of the hotel are relatively noisy.   Good hotel for extended stay purposes.
Manager Response: Thank you for a great feedback! Happy summer! We are so looking forward to host any of your future visits in the beautiful South Orange County!  Cheers!!! Grace M.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but train traffic at 5 AM ruins experience
Summary: This hotel is clean and roomy.  The staff are friendly and attentive.  However, nothing can overcome the trains that run next to the property.  The first trains came through sat 5:13 AM one day and 5:48 AM the next day.  They sound their horns when approaching the hotel, and even the heaviest sleepers will be awakened.  An incredibly poor choice of location.  In addition, the Wi-Fi was very intermittent.  Overall one of the worst experiences I have ever had in a Marriott property, and I have spend over 1000 nights in Marriott properties!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your recent stay with us. We appreciate your kind words in regards to the cleanliness and the attentive staff. As for the train disturbance, please accept our sincere apology.  We are working on a long term solution to lessen the disturbance for our guest. Thank you again for your feedback and for being our guest. We hope to get the chance to better serve you next time your travels bring you to San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: We were booked for 2 nights.We were told that we were on the view side of the property, i.e. looking over the costco to see the sea and some palm trees. However the clerk failed to mention that the railroad runs right next to that side of the property. The trains started approx 5.45 am and the last toot I would hear was around 11.00pm so if you are a light sleeper, or have babies,or plan on sleeping in, I suggest asking for a room as far away from the train, if possible. The room was nice and updated, the breakfast standard residence inn fare.It was pleasant to eat out by the pool. The other thing we didn't anticipate is the $12 per night parking fee.I asked the clerk if the charge was for being in a parking garage, she said no.  To me It was just the basic residence in parking
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has a great location and full hot breakfast.  This property is pet friendly and easy access off I-5.  I love that it has a full kitchen with an Albertsons down the street.  The Pacific Ocean is only a few minute drive away.  The staff is friendly and the king bed very comfortable.  The kids loved the pool, nightly desert at 7pm and the basketball hoop.  Great for families traveling to Orange County.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel is OK but we would not return
Summary: My husand, dogs and kids have been on a 21 day journey driving from the Philly area down the eastern seaboard across the Gulf Coast region.  OUr last leg was a long drive from Tucson across the 119 degree desert.  We finally landed at our destination on July 22 so I can tell you I have stayed at a lot of hotels across this great nation.  Equally I was a Marriott Platinum for 5 years so I have stayed at a lot of Marriotts (you have to stay >75 nights to be Platinum).  This hotel has some great advantages but it falls short in others.  My biggest advice is find a new hotel manager.  A lot of these issues are related to poor managment not a bad hotel.  Wake up and realize that there is SO much competition in hospitality and with social media and the ease of mobile apps people will
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your recent experience in regards to your stay with us. Please accept our sincerest apology for the many missed opportunities to better serve you during your stay. Rest assured that we take feedback such as this extremely serious and we will be sharing it with the entire staff to better our service. Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss this further. Thank you again for your feedback and for being our guest. We hope to get the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: When I first got off of the exit for this hotel, I was a little hesitant, old part of town and didn't look like much in the area.  Wasn't sure I was gonna stay there?  Checked into hotel, front desk and lobby was very nice, employees very friendly! My room could not have been nicer or cleaner!  Full kitchen, comfy bed, nice living area, (with work station area,)  wish I could have stayed longer to utilize it all!  Complimentary small snacks and drinks from 6:00-7:30 nightly.  I really wanted a nice dinner, but too tired to drive anywhere else.  The front desk clerk told me there was a nice Italian restaurant near by.  The snack ended up being enough.  Complimentary breakfast is nice, you have to go to 2 separate rooms to get everything, but it is OK I guess.  Free Wi-Fi and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel during busy July 4th Weekend
Summary: This was a great hotel close to many areas of Dana Point and San Juan Capistrano.  We were in town for 5 nights for a family reunion, and this hotel was easy to get in and out of for both DP and SJC.  The only negative we experienced was getting in late to find the main parking lot full so we had to park in the overflow 3 out of 5 nights, which was behind the property and down the hill - two story staircase took us to the hotel.  But I was well lit and seemed secure, so not a huge deal.  We were in a king efficiency room, and it was very well appointed with dishes, pots/pans, coffee pot, toaster and full size fridge.  Nice and reasonably comfortable sofa and large work desk were in the living area, and a VERY Comfy king size bed in the sleeping area.  The bathroom area was a
Manager Response: none

Summary: My associates and I recently attended a business luncheon meeting here and had an opportunity to tour the property. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and have an ocean view.  The outdoor amenities which include a fire pit, pool/spa, and sport court make for an excellent experience for the entire family.  The rooms were quite spacious, included everything you could possibly want,  and still felt new.  I was also impressed to find out that they serve a complimentary HOT breakfast every morning.   The location of this hotel so close to the beaches and only a few miles to shopping at Outlets at San Clemente make it a great destination for anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay in Residence Inns often, and this one was fine.  The rooms were very clean and the bedrooms were spacious.  The living room/kitchen was fine, but not quite as "homey" as most of the "R I" hotels I have stayed in.  This would be an excellent hotel for someone in the area on business.  The location is very convenient to Dana Point Harbor and the freeway.  I would stay there again, but I might try something different next time I am in the area.    It is a higher rate  than most Residence Inns, but very reasonable for the location.  It is a little noisy on the freeway side.  The check OUT clerk was very friendly and nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a well managed and cared for hotel! Everything was clean and consistent. Ease of check in was amazing and they will accommodate you early if at all possible. Katora greeted us warmly and professionally and made sure we had everything we need. It even comes with a hearty complimentary breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel for your long or short stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel to host a large group
Summary: I was traveling with approximately 30 other coworkers for a week long training. It was the perfect location for everyone to socialize and relax after a long day. The evening receptions, food truck, basketball court, and firepit made our trip so much more fun than a normal hotel. Walking distance to the Dana Point Marina and all of the fabulous restaurants there! Rooms were nicely spacious and clean. HOWEVER, I was in room 204 (I think) and the Amtrak train runs directly through that room! If you are a light sleeper please ask to be o the other side of the hotel! They lay on the horn every hour, on the hour as they blow past! Maybe soundproofed windows? More insulation? I am not sure there is a solution but it is loud...
Manager Response: Hello! It was our pleasure hosting your group!!!!!!! We are so pleased that the team had a fantastic time with us up here in the beautiful South Orange County!  I am so sorry about the train noise issue. The hotel will continue to provide creative ways to address this daily with our guests. We are also working on a long-term solution on this regard onwards. Thank you for your feedback.  Have a wonderful summer ahead!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: The property is located on a hillside offering suites with nice views of the surrounding hills and the distant ocean. The comfortable beds and bath are nicely updated with all necessary amenities. In the spacious living area is a second flat screen TV, couch, desk and a fully furnished kitchen. Great for a light dinner in. The complimentary breakfast buffet is outstanding and replenished promptly. If your busy all day, you can have groceries delivered to your kitchen. Very convenient!  Ask for a suite away from the train that goes through the valley, if you prefer peace and quiet. The train whistle was annoying. Everything else at this property is outstanding!
Manager Response: Hello!!! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! Rest assured that this will be shared with the rest of the team! Indeed - the hotel is on a beautiful location! We are just a mile or so away from Doheny State Beach and Dana Pont Harbor! North of us - is the rustic and historic, City of San Juan Capistrano. We are so pleased that you enjoyed our hotel and the scenic beauty of South Orange County! Have a wonderful summer ahead! We are so looking forward to host your next visit! Cheers! -Grace

Summary Heading: First room had broken AC, second room water damage along baseboards
Summary: Hotel maintenance and front desk responsiveness issues.  Plus, besides the $380 for two nights and a $100 deposit, they also charged $110 erroneously.   Very average for a Residence Inn.   Front desk is run by young people (every time we were there in 3 days) who are generally inept and inefficient.   Not a good stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience in regards to your recent stay with us. Please accept our sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay. Your feedback has been shared with the appropriate departments in order to ensure this is corrected moving forward. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to get another chance to serve you when your travels bring you back our way.

Summary: I frequently stay in Residence Inns, as the rooms are always similar in layout (I really like their studios, which have full kitchens, which is great for people traveling with families). They also provide a free breakfast, which kids really seem to enjoy. This RI is very nice- the common areas as well as the rooms are very nicely decorated and kept up. There is a distant view of the ocean, and their pool area is the nicest I've seen in a RI so far. They are usually indoors. They also had a basketball court, which my son loved.  The hotel is very close to the tourist sites as well as to the freeway.  The only negative we experienced (which is why I didn't give it 5 stars) was that the AC unit was in a closet next to my bed, and it was noisy, but it wasn't a huge deal. We had a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience in regards to your recent stay. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for the feedback and the kind words. Thank you for being our guest. We look forward to hosting you during your future travel to the area.

Summary: We stayed with our son and daughter-in-law in a two-bedroom suite. Comfortable, spacious, nicely designed. The living room was not huge, but the bedrooms and kitchen were very spacious. Good breakfast and nice areas to eat outside. Clean and well-maintained. Trains are audible from time to time.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for the feedback. We are so pleased that you enjoyed our spacious rooms and well-designed product! The hotel is custom built and was designed to cater both short and long term stays! We are so looking forward to host any of your future stay up here in the beautiful South Orange County!  Have a wonderful summer ahead!  Cheers!

Summary: We recently spent the weekend here in San Juan Capistrano- throughly enjoyed our stay at this Residence Inn. The full hot breakfast and morning attendants were exceptional.  Rooms were clean and very large. Though not much walking distance - the hotel is just off the freeway and very close to the Old Mission and quaint downtown shops and restaurants. Very enjoyable and relaxing. Love Marriott and Residence Inns!
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so pleased that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast, clean rooms and custom built product. Yes, we are only a mile or so away from the Historic Mission San Juan Capistrano and the Los Rios District (birthplace of Orange County). I am sure that you had a wonderful experience exploring our rustic and historic city! South of us, just a mile or so away is the scenic Dana Point Harbor and Doheny State Beach. We trust that you had an opportunity to explore this as well! If not - save this on your next visit :). We are so looking forward to see you on your next trip! Have a wonderful summer ahead!  Cheers!

Summary: Good place to stay, next time I need to book a room with a bathtub. Breakfast is always good. Very helpful people at the front desk. Enjoy the outdoor pool and spa also the work out area. Noise from the freeway or the construction going on near by the hotel did not make much of a big disturbance.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for the feedback! We are so looking forward for your next visit! Have a wonderful week!  Cheers! Grace and Team

Summary: The hotel is classic Residence Inn with lite-duty service. The location is next to the I-5 and close to historic downtown area and train depot. It's an Uber ride or car ride to the beach. The view of the ocean is nice as long as you tune out the Costco in the immediate foreground. The barbecue grill is high end so you'll want to use it...
Manager Response: Hi Dan - thank you for your feedback. We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!   Have a wonderful Spring!  Cheers! -RI San Juan Leadership Team

Summary: Four days on a business trip and I live the suite!  Very happy with the the facility and the grounds.  Less than a mile away from Albertsons and so close to the beach.  This place is fantastic!  Wonderful staff.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for the great feedback! Yes, we are only a mile or so away from the Dana Point Harbor and the Doheny State beach. Indeed - it is a beautiful location!   We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M

Summary Heading: Noisy, the staff does a real good job.
Summary: So like the title of my review says this place has a lot of noise, Highway traffic, a train, sirens (it is after all, So Cal) and even construction equipment back up alarms. BUT the pool is nice, the back patio faces the water and most important is the staff. They were ALL very professional and did a great job with the after 5pm bar snacks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay. Please accept our apology for the noise disturbance you experienced. Also, thank you for your kind words about the staff and the hotel amenities. Thank you again for sharing your feedback and for being our guest. We look forward to providing you with service so memorable the next time your travels brings you back to San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: First the positive.  The room safe extremely spacious (we had a King).  Kitchenette, sofa, fridge, dishwasher, the works.  It was also very clean.  So props to them for that.  The bad?  It took an architectural imbecile to build a hotel right next to railroad tracks that are used 24/7.  Being we were in room 303, we were the room closest to the railroad tracks so we heard that damn train in the middle of the night, the morning, the evening ALL THE TIME.  The tracks were literally 50 yards from our window.  And when the train is NOT coming, the traffic cane heard even thru the double paned windows.  We tried to switch rooms immediately on check in at 2:00 PM on a Friday afternoon only to be told very insincerely, "Sorry, we're all booked up."  Like everyone is already checked in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the San Juan Capistrano Dana Point Residence Inn by Marriott. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the train noise and the lack of flexibility shown in regards to your request.  I will be sharing your feedback with the appropriate team members to ensure this is corrected moving forward. Thank you again for your feedback and for being our guest. I hope we get the chance to serve you and your family once your travels bring you back to San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: Newer RI located at the intersection of two busy roads so pretty noisy in the outside facing rooms.  Seems to be new, built with interior corridors.  Rooms nicely decorated, well equipped and well laid out.  Pool & whirlpool have a lovely view out to the ocean.  Felt the $12 parking fee pretty high considering it was off season and plenty of parking.
Manager Response: It was our pleasure hosting your stay! Thank you for your feedback.  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area.  Have a wonderful spring time ahead!  Cheers! -Leadership Team

Summary: As most of you frequent travelers know - Residence Inns are about as consistent as it comes for Marriott.  Like Courtyard and Fairfield..you can wake up and not know if you are in Boston or Baton Rouge.  No different here.  Nice, clean hotel with a small touch of local flare in the lobby.    My only complaint would be the road noise of highway 5 outside the door.  Other than that, decent hotel - but not walking distance to anything near by.
Manager Response: Hello and happy New Year!  It was our pleasure hosting your stay! We appreciate your feedback with the Interstate-5 construction. The hotel is proactively partnering with the Orange County Transportation Commission to minimize the impact of the issues that may come up due to the construction. Thank you for your understanding. Also, thank you for a great feedback on the cleanliness and the upkeep of our product. We are so looking forward to host your future visit in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: This place was awesome. The staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful. DeAndre the manager will stop at nothing to make guests happy. And he seems to be there 24x7. The west-facing rooms have incredible views of Doheny Beach and the ocean. Rooms are tremendous, walking in for the first time really felt like coming home! I can think of no place I would rather stay on the road than this particular hotel. We made frequent use of the full kitchen (with all plates, pans, utensils, full oven/range, dishwasher, microwave, full-size refrigerator). There's an Albertson's about a half-mile away so stocking the place was easy -- apparently the staff will even shop for you if you request it.  Best of all, pets are accepted and welcome. Lots of cats and dogs here during our stay. It's
Manager Response: Hello and Happy New Year!!!!  Thank you for this amazing feedback - rest assured that this will be shared with De'Andre and team!  We are so looking forward to host your future stay! Wishing your and yours the best in 2016!  Cheers from all us! -Grace M. and the RI team

Summary: Stayed here rather than our preferred Best Western because of the two room suite which allowed me to keep an eye on my mother who has early Alzheimers as well as my two kids. The suites are fairly spacious and a good option.  Unfortunately, our second of two stays during a trip from Hawaii back to the east coast met us with a filthy bathroom, no towels or soap. A call to the front desk addressed  the issues fairly quickly and our parking was comp'd. Janet who works the desk 11-7 was nothing short of spectacular - she gives my review the 4th star. Breakfast is good and location is key. However, next time it's back to the Best Western Dana Point.
Manager Response: Hello and Happy New Year!  We deeply appreciate the feedback - rest assured that this will be addressed on our end.  We deeply apologized we did not do above and beyond service during your stay. Please let us know how we can assist you more on your future visit. We would love to have you back the next time around.  Thank you for the positive note that you shared about Janet! This will be shared with her and the rest of the team.  Have a wonderful week! Sincerely, Grace & the RI team

Summary: The hotel room had a great little kitchen which is important to me because I have severe food allergies. The only thing missing from it was an oven. The king bed was comfy and there was a large shower, but no tub for our toddler. We didnt get to see the hotel's amenities because we were just in town for a funeral. I would stay again :)
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Wishing you and yours - the best of holidays ahead!  Cheers! -Grace M

Summary: Stayed here twice and the staff is all very accommodating. Lovely property, looks very new. One front desk agent who stood out to us was Bryanna. She is the definition of great customer service and definitely deserves to be recognized.   Although the property was lovely and rooms were nicely kept, I do want to point out the $12 fee for parking which is a bit of a downfall for a residence inn, in San Juan Capistrano. Anyhow, the stay was outstanding both times and we will be staying here again. Thanks Bryanna!
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! Rest assured that this will be shared with Bryanna and the rest of the team!  We trust that you had a wonderful Thanksgiving! So looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have wonderful holidays ahead!  Warm Regards, Grace M

Summary: Our room was clean and the size and room amenities met our needs. There is some construction ongoing with the adjacent freeway but we did not hear any noise over the weekend (only an occasional train horn until around 11:00 PM). You really do not need to worry about a view. The front side of the hotel overlooks the Residence Inn parking lot and car dealership across the street while the back hill side overlooks train tracks, a mobile home park and Costco's parking lot. The back of the property also has a bit more noise from other guests, since this is where the recreational areas are located. The Residence Inn mixer is also only held Monday - Wednesday and there was not a local shuttle as advertised on the website.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback in regards to your recent stay.  We appreciate your kind words in regards to the room cleanliness and space. As for the train, we are working on a long term solution for the train noise.  Thank you again for your feedback and for being our guest. We look forward to serving you next time your travels bring you back our way.

Summary: This proved to be a quiet location despite the proximity to 5.  Convenient to San Juan, Laguna and Dana Point.  Very clean and well equipped rooms.  Friendly and helpful staff.  I was amazed.  When I had an issue with the clock in the room I mentioned it at reception and the maintenance guy was there to fix it almost immediately!.  The one oddity is that, unusually for a Residence Inn, they charge $12 for parking.  Factor that into your costing.  Thoroughly recommended.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! Rest assured that your positive comments on our service will be shared with our team!  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area.  Happy holidays ahead!  Cheers! -Grace and Team

Summary: We were in town for a funeral and had other family staying there as well with a generous bereavement rate which we really appreciate. Except for the noise from the road, train, and freeway it is a very nice hotel with a great staff. The breakfast was great, the pool nice and the rooms spacious and clean. We thought the $12.00 parking fee was a little usurious though for this type of hotel, and for that we shouldn't have to drive around and around looking for a space when we came back at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback in regards to your recent stay with us.  I would like to apologize for disturbance caused by the train and the road.  We are working on a long term solution for the train. I would also like to thank you for the kind words in regards to the staff and property we really appreciate it.  Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Summary: This is a great place to stay! We went down to San Juan Capistrano with friends for a ling weekend. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. We stayed in a studio that included a kitchen, lounge/ desk area, king sized bed and a stand up shower. The building was well maintained and very clean. Lots to do and see in the area.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have a wonderful holidays ahead!  Cheers! Grace and team!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel on business last week, and I was treated very well by the staff.  My check-in was smooth, and the person working the front desk was very friendly.  My room was large and comfortable.  I had a meeting with a business colleague the morning following my check-in at the nearby Doubletree Hotel.  When I returned to the Residence Inn, I requested a late check-out, which was given at no additional charge.  I very much appreciated the hospitality.  This Residence Inn has a lot of the same amenities as other Residence Inn properties, but the location is very nice.  It is near the I-5 interstate with easy access on and off the highway.  It is not located on Doheny Beach, but it is an easy drive to the beach.  The hotel has an outdoor pool and an exercise room.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. As we pride ourselves on providing service so memorable, we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to serving you next time your travels bring you to San Juan Capistrano.

Summary Heading: The $12 parking fee is a joke
Summary: The hotel is pretty new and the staff are great.  However, they charge a $12 parking fee...with a ridiculously big parking lot...far from the beach.  I am a platinum Marriott Rewards member and I have never stayed at a Marriott property in a similar location that charged a parking fee.  It is nothing more than an upcharge on the room rate.  There would be no one staying at this hotel due to its location who was not driving a car.  Remove this blatant surcharge for guests...particularly those guests who stay at Marriott properties 75+ (in my case well over 100+) nights/year.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the San Juan Capistrano Dana Point Residence Inn by Marriott. Thank you for your nice words in regards to the property and the staff.  I understand your frustration as it pertains to the parking fee.  Rest assured that your feedback will be shared with the entire leadership team.  Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to hosting you the next time your travels bring you to San Juan Capistrano.

Summary: We stayed at this Marriott property while visiting relatives. The hotel was clean and service was great. The free breakfast was as good as any of the breakfasts I've had at other properties.  Things to know:  1) This is a pet friendly hotel which I didn't know until I got to the room and saw the tag you can hang on the door saying there was a pet inside. I think people should be given an option of having a room that has never had a pet in it. Allergies?  2) We had a room on the Costco side of the hotel. It is very close to a train track. We definitely heard trains until about 10 at night blowing their whistles. They either stop at 10 or I was so tired I didn't hear but be aware. I heard again at 5:45am.  3) There is a $12 parking fee. Most Marriotts will wave the fee depending
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have a wonderful summer!  Cheers! -Grace M

Summary Heading: Comfortable Room with Nice Breakfast with Good Freeway Access
Summary: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this property.  Because the property is a Residence Inn, the room was very large and we appreciated the full kitchen.  The hotel offers two breakfast rooms, as well as outdoor seating near the pool.  Although there were plenty of nice choices of prepared food, we enjoyed the opportunity to make our own, fresh waffles.  We liked the whipped cream and strawberries to dress our waffles.  Although the hotel is close to the freeway, we did not hear freeway noise.  The only surprise was that the property charged a parking fee of $12 per day.  We would not hesitate to stay at this property again.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for this great feedback! We are so pleased that you had a fantastic stay with us! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers for the summer!  -Grace M

Summary Heading: It felt like a home away from home
Summary: The property is awesome, the room was spotless and big.  I'm small so it seemed large for just little old me.  I stayed for roughly two weeks but i didn't really feel like i was in a hotel.  The staff was fantastic Joey B. and Joey D. in the morning greeting you during free breakfast was funny.  The front desk staff was awesome especially when i lost my wallet and had mail come to the hotel for my replacement items.  Alma, Tschanavia and Carly indulged me every day when i came in after work and asked "Did I get any mail today." They were beyond nice and helpful!!! They even apologized for the noise one night because some idiot other guest decided to smoke inn their rooms at 12:48 am and had the fire alarms go off (smh). lol
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so looking to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers for the summer!  -Grace M

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights this June with my husband and 2 dogs. I loved that the hotel was pet friendly with a $100 non refundable pet cleaning deposit. The hotel room was spacious with king bed and sleeper sofa and quite clean. Everything looked recently updated. We were at the end of the hall so it was very quiet as requested. The hotel is located right off the freeway and close to may nearby attractions such as the beaches and the Mission. There is also a trolley that makes a stop here to pick you to take you to many of the attractions in the area. Breakfast is also included but don't hope for much. Eggs were extremely dry and the waffle iron could never get quite hot enough to produce a crispy waffle. Other that that, we had a pleasant stay with friendly staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have a wonderful summer!  Cheers! -Grace M

Summary Heading: Friendly, Comfortable, Convenient, Well Managed Hotel.
Summary: We were in San Juan Capistrano for a relative's wedding. Almost all of our family, 15 people, stayed in the Residence Inn.We reserved months in advance.The Inn is a few miles from the old Spanish mission. We had a car and never had a parking problem at the Inn. There is a daily charge for parking. The day we arrived the trolley that goes through town began operation for the tourist season. It went to the mission and a few other sites in town and made stops at 3 or 4 hotels. It made scheduled stops at the Resident Inn.The complementary breakfast each morning included eggs and bacon or sausage.There were numerous choices and abundant food each morning. The 2 guys who stocked the breakfast were energetic and humorous. They cheerfully cleared our table while we visited with
Manager Response: Hello and happy summer! It was our pleasure to host your stay! Rest assured that we will share your great comments to our breakfast attendants and Front desk associates!  We are so looking forward to host your next trip in the area!  Cheers! Grace and Team

Summary Heading: ONLY HOTEL I CHECK IN TO
Summary: I always enjoy staying at this hotel. The staff here always help me out and its one of the many reasons I stay here at least 3-4 times a month. I always get the suite and its always clean and organized.
Manager Response: Hi Daniel! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host you again this summer!  Cheers! Grace M & Team

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, but lousy customer service
Summary: Stayed here with a number of guests on the night of our son's wedding and we all got the same snotty attitude on check in, one group had room mix ups, breakfast staff attitude was dreadful... Guest to breakfast staff 15 minutes before end of breakfast, looking at virtually locust stripped breakfast selection: Please could I get some more pancake batter? Staff: It's too late Guest: But there's still 15 minutes and there's no food. Can you get more batter? Staff: Wanders off and asks loudly if is supposed to do that sort of thing....  We liked the room, clean and really great facilities. But honestly, they soured some of the guests who had flown 6000 miles to attend the wedding. We felt like we were annoying them by daring to ask if we could check in a bit early to change, sit
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at our hotel. I would like to apologize on behalf of the entire staff, that we did not meet your expectation. Please rest assured that this is a top priority and your comments have been shared with the entire staff. Thank you again for the feedback and for being our guest. We hope you give us another chance to serve you in the future.

Summary: Not many choices in S.J.C so we booked a King room for 2 of us.The room was fine,clean & stocked.Fridge turned almost off,no ice.(didn't need the fridge,,,but no ice)We stayed 2 days & asked if there were any room that were blocked for NO DOGS (we love dogs,but don't like to stay in hotels with them)the desk said "no" noticed lots of dogs around.The breakfast was disgusting..gross..dirty,cold food,the only good thing was the oatmeal,but they never refilled the raisins,nuts etc. from the day before...containers were filthy. The hot tub was always filled with children swimming...with toys..every time we went to use it...we liked the fire-pit ...but hubby got bit by fleas from too many dogs around. The only good thing we the gal that checked us in..Her name began with a T...Drive
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide us with some feedback inregards to your rercent  experience at our hotel. I would like to apologize that we did not meet your expectation. As for the cleanliness and food qauality of our breakfast, please rest assured that this is a top priority and your comments have will be shared with the breakfast staff. Thank you again for the feedback and for being our guest. We hope you give us another chance to serve you in the future.

Summary: This hotel is in a great location for whatever you are wanting to do in the area as well as grocery stores.  The staff was incredibly friendly and the grounds were beautiful.  Pool, hot tub, basketball court and a small putting green were very nice.  They even have golf clubs and a basketball that you can use!  There is some construction and a train that runs by that could disturb some people. The suite we stayed in was very comfortable and the bed and pillows were amazing.  We would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words inregards to our hotel and the staff. We really appreciate it! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to get another chance to provide you with memorable service in the future.

Summary: Some construction work was being done on our house and this is where we were re-housed.  It was a good choice.  Comfortable room, well appointed kitchen and extremely clean.  The staff were very courteous and went above and beyond to be helpful.  They checked us in early and let us stay late, which was most appreciated.  The breakfast staff were right there -- asking if there was anything more we needed or wanted.  The  hotel's website mentioned construction on the I-5, saying that noise may be a problem.  We were not disturbed at all by construction noise.  We did, however, hear the train:  Not horribly, but you will likely be aware of the train passing by.  Good proximity to Costco and Doheny Beach -- we walked to both of them.  Good stay!  The Residence Inn is a great choice!
Manager Response: Greetings!  Happy Summer! Thank you for this great feedback! Indeed - it was a pleasure hosting your stay! Thank you for making the hotel as your "second home" during this transition. We are so pleased that you/family had a fantastic stay with us! Rest assured that your wonderful comments will be shared to the team.  Wishing you and yours the best this summer season!  Cheers! -Grace

Summary: We stayed for two nights (family with young children) while visiting the area.  We chose it due to proximity to beach (1 mile away and close to Dana Point where we went on a whale watching tour).  The breakfast was excellent and plentiful.  The rooms were very nice and spacious, king size bed was so comfortable.   There was a great pull out couch that had room for 3 young kids.    The best part of this hotel was the outdoor activities -beautiful hot tub & pool overlooking the city, golf putting, basketball court, use of a gas grill available, fire pit and great views of the city.  Outdoor area had the feel of a resort.    Parking was $12 which didn't seem necessary given parking was plentiful and there it was self-park.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.  For a Residence
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I really appreciate the kind words regarding your arrival and the assistance you received from Tschanavia.  I will ensure she gets the proper recognition. Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for the weekend, with a large group attending a wedding. Many thanks to Tschanavia for making check-in so easy. She was extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. She answered all my wife's questions regarding the positive/negative of each available room. Saturday morning, out entire group went down to breakfast at the same time. Needless to say, the breakfast area was overwhelmed. But the team handled it very well. Katora was incredibly friendly and working hard replenishing food and making sure each of us had what we needed. Finally, Sunday's breakfast was made even better by being welcomed and served by Joey. Thanks to a great team for our visit.
Manager Response: Greetings!!!! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! The team was very pleased that you/family had a fantastic stay with us!  Big shout out for Katora and Tschanavia - job well done!  Cheers! Grace and team

Summary Heading: Great stay for a few days
Summary: Stayed in a two room suite for 5 days with two teenagers and a dog.  The room was great, the staff were almost all wonderful.  The breakfast was a hit with my kids.  We walked to the beach every morning early; the river trail and park is close by and a direct route to the beach. Not really sure why we had to pay to park at the hotel when there was free parking down at the marina; it was not a busy time of year.  The only negative was that we could not sit outside at the firepit because there was someone smoking cigars out there each night.  Great place with a dog; a nice green area in back for late nigh and early morning bathroom breaks.  Watch for the rabbits; our dog sure did.
Manager Response: Hi Chris! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future visit in the area.   Cheers to for a great summer!  Best, Grace M

Summary: This hotel was in a convenient location, and the rooms were spacious and well laid out.  It's what you'd expect for a Residence Inn; clean, comfortable, but not necessarily fancy.  Our room had a view of the water, and even though it was near a highway, it was quiet (with the exception of the occasional train!)   My only real complaint was the breakfast.  It was very mediocre, and they were constantly running out of things, without any sign that they were going to be refilled.  We took a look at the dinner one night, and it was slim and meager, so we didn't stay.  If I were to return to this area, I would stay here again.  It was a good value!
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful feedback - it was our pleasure hosting your stay!   Yes, we do have spacious rooms that you can spread out and relax.  It is not just "a room, it's a residence"! We are so pleased that you enjoyed our customized product nestled in this very scenic southern part of Orange County.  Thank you for your feedback about our breakfast. This is a progressive opportunity that we are focusing on considering our high demand this summer. Rest assured that we are implementing processes to better the service in this area.  Have a wonderful summer! We are so looking forward to host your stay again in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: Easy to get to from San Clemente Beach.  Kind of a weird location.  Nothing too close by, but plenty not too far away.  Rooms can be a little noisy since you are near the freeway, but not too bad.  Breakfast is standard Residence Inn fare, which is actually pretty good.  Rooms were clean, beds were comfy, staff was kind of disinterested, internet service was kind of slow
Manager Response: Thank you for a great feedback! We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us! Indeed - we are just minutes away to some of the most beautiful scenic spots and beaches in South Orange County - San Clemente, Dana Point, Salt Creek and Laguna Beach.  We are so looking forward to host you again soon!  Have a wonderful summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: We spent a month General manger Gipson was extremely helpful. He went to great lengths to be sure that our visit was excellent. Both he and his staff went out of their way to make us happy. The work on the 405 should be done, so the noise factor not be a problem. Do yourself a favor and stay here.
Manager Response: Fantastic! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!   Your wonderful comment/feedback was shared with De'Andre and team!  Cheers! -Grace M

Summary: After giving this hotel a second and a third chance, maybe it's time to say forget it!  Being a very loyal Marriott customer, platinum level, I expect so much more from this chain.  The staff was very disinterested in assisting us.  When I asked if we could have a view of the pool, I was told we are fully booked.  You have a good room.  That "good" room overlooked the garbage dumpsters.  The breakfast area was dirty and the food scanty and very linited.  This is a fairly new Residence Inn in a good location that needs to work harder to maintain Marriott standards. So disappointing,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at our hotel.  I would like to apologize on behalf of the entire staff, that we did not meet your expectation.  We will take every necessary step to better serve our guest and continue the Marriott’s spirit to serve mantra. You also mentioned the cleanliness of our breakfast area, please rest assured that this is a top priority and your comments have been shared with the breakfast staff.  Thank you again for the feedback and for being our guest. We hope you give us another chance to serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: The Best stay in the WORST situation. Marriott should make Colin a Manager!
Summary: I was in town with Pro NFL Players (Icons) and arrived to find (1-800) Reservations SCREWED up and canceled our rooms. I was FURIOUS! It wasnt the property's fault but a Front Desk Employee named Colin was the MOST AWESOME,KIND,UNDERSTANDING and dedicated person I have EVER encountered at Marriott! THis 21ish yr old not only appologized, attempted to accomidate but stood by my side for SIX HOURS while I fought with central reservations, yelled, screamed, reasoned and was at my wits end! Colin even got on the phone and repremanded the jerks on the other end.  He ordered Pizza for us to help ease the pain and continued to distract me with humor and lecture with kindness.  I have NEVER met anyone who would stand by a CUSTOMER like Colin! THis guy is amazing.  He finally worked his
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such kind words in regards to the service provided by Colin.  He embodies everything that we are about here at the San Juan Capistrano Dana Point Residence Inn by Marriott.  I will ensure he gets the proper acknowledgement that he deserves. Thank you again for your time and have a nice day.   Best,  De'Andre G

Summary: One of the worst experience I've ever had at a Residence Inn. No customer service, barely edible breakfast, and the pool, BBQ, spa area was closed off for filming. Nothing was done to accommodate guests for their inconvenience. And my friend who also had a reservation was turned away because of overbooking to accommodate the production crew. Taking care of their guests is NOT a priority at this hotel
Manager Response: Hello! I am deeply sorry for this poor experience. It will be great if I can reconnect with you - and personally apologize for all the inconvenience that you went through during your stay.   Again, please accept our deep apology on this regard. Please let us the best time to call you.   Leadership team email:  ri.snasj.gm@marriott.com; de'andre.gipson@marriott.com.  Sincerely, -Grace M.

Summary: The hotel is very clean family and pet friendly.  The manager's reception is not worth the time or effort typically there are 5 or 6 individuals that devour the small amount of scraps they put out. I know it free but really when the hotel parking lot is filled I would expect something of more quantity not necessarily quality.   Sunday breakfast they were attempting to close at 9:30 only the constant stream of people kept it open. And again not enough for the number of guests.  The 4 star rating is for the room and front desk. As I don't think deduction for freebies is necessary.
Manager Response: Hello and happy New Year! Thank you for the feedback - we are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Deeply appreciate your thought regarding our complimentary evening social reception and breakfast. We will continue to re-visit our processes and identify areas to better our service.  Wishing you and yours - the best in 2015!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: We stay in 30-60 hotels a year. This was the loudest location I have ever experienced. The last reviews mentioned the train, but it needs to be mentioned they do sound the horn and night. Literally right outside my window. 1am, 2:15, 2:45, 3:30.....to make it worse, promptly at 0630 an industrial jack hammer or drill starts pounding away doing construction in the highway. My colleague who was on the other side of hall said the traffic noise on the street next to hotel was awful. This wasn't the highway.   Hotel has great rooms and a beautiful outdoor space, but its proximity to the train tracks should be a huge deterrent.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with the San Juan Capistrano Dana Point Residence Inn by Marriott. I would like to apologize for the noise you experienced. We are currently looking into a long term solution for the train noise. Thank you again for your feedback and for being our guest.

Summary: First I could have given this place 5 stars but only due to the train issue. You cannot go wrong with staying here but chose a front of the hotel room as the back has an active train track 1000 feet that trains pass several times a day/night Blowing their horn. The location was perfect for Dana point activities that we had. Yet the hotel was clean, very well maintained and the staff was exceptional. Alma greeted us when we checked in and she was spectacular . We called on her from forgotten toothpaste to directions, I thought that this is the kind of employee that represents the marriott quality. Maria was a housekeeper that seemed to revel in care. I was missing a kitchen item and while there was no rush she arranged for it to be at my door in minutes. She was a genuine person.
Manager Response: Hello and happy happy New Year!!!!! Thank you for this wonderful feedback - rest assured that we will share this with Maria and team!  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! Best to you and yours!  -Grace M.

Summary: Our room was quite impressive considering we had never stayed at a Residence Inn before. I loved the room, but the complimentary breakfast was pretty sad. I guess if you're staying here you can take advantage of the in-room kitchen and grocery delivery to make your own breakfast.
Manager Response: HI Stacy!  Thank you for the wonderful that you shared about our guest rooms! Yes, that is true, our guest rooms are a lot bigger than a regular hotel room - more space to work, relax and unwind at the end of the day! We are so pleased that your family had a great time enjoying our in-room amenities.  We would love to hear about some specifics on your breakfast experience. Thank you for the feedback. We are always here listening to our guests/clients on how we can do it better.  Please let us know the best time to call you - leadership emails are: ri.snasj.gm@marriott.com or De'Andre.gipson@marriott.com.  Have a wonderful holiday ahead!  Cheers! -Grace M. and team

Summary: Excellent room with outfitted kitchen for extended stays, living room and work-area - ours had a view of the Pacific Ocean. They had a far better than typical complimentary breakfast buffet, including a fountain drink station for those who need their cold caffeine fix (cokes) for breakfast as well as the typical coffee and juices.  There  is a great outdoor pool/Jacuzzi with a view of the ocean.  This area included a BBQ area with a basketball court and mini golf putting green area. There are a few social hours during the week with beer/wine and light food options  - check with the front desk on the specifics while you are there.  It was very conveniently located and easy to get to off of the 5 but wasn't noisy or loud at all. It is located 5 minutes from the Dana Point Harbor.
Manager Response: Hi Pat,  I trust that you had a wonderful Thanksgiving! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have fantastic holidays ahead!  Best, -Grace M.

Summary Heading: Nice - but ask for room on South side
Summary: It is the typical Residence Inn with kitchen and living room amenities.  A breakfast buffet is included and there are a couple evening "social hours" with beer/wine and a light dinner menu.  There is a firepit at the edge of the property, looking down the hill.  You can see a little shippet of ocean from the south side (same side as pool and firepit.)  My primary recommendation is to ask for a room on the South side.  We spent all of 1 minute in a room on the 3rd floor North side and could hear afternoon traffic quite well with the windows shut.  I can only imagine what the rush-hour traffic was like.  Very loud.  Thankfully, they moved us over to the South side and all was well.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for your feedback on regards to your with us this month. Deeply appreciate your flexibility and understanding during your stay. We have recycle bins that are spread out at the property - however, I like your suggestion in providing something in the room. We will explore this opportunity - if not we can add more bins on each floor for easy access to guests.   Thanks again for your feedback! Have a wonderful Thanksgiving!  Best! -Grace M.

Summary: This is located right off the highway, which is good and bad.  The rooms are pretty standard and there is definitely nothing wrong with them.  You have to pay for parking, $12/day, which I found fairly outrageous for a Residence Inn next to a highway.  The front desk staff is very friendly and willing to help you out.  However, when I asked a room away from the highway, I was given a handicap room.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with the Residence Inn Dana Point San Juan Capistrano. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience you may have experienced.  We take great pride in ensuring our guest’s satisfaction.  Unfortunately, we did not meet your—or our own—expectations.  You’re a valued customer; everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience.  We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.

Summary: My first stay at a Marriott Residence. We were there for a wedding. Great location, right on the Interstate, but you don't get any noise from traffic. Very clean, comfortable and modern. Great pool and sports court. Tasty breakfast. Only bad thing, we had dinner included in our weekday rate and we weren't aware of that till check out. Wi definitely be back.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for the kind words about our hotel.  I am glad to hear you were able to enjoy our many hotel amenities during your stay.  I apologize that you did not get to enjoy our evening social however; this gives you a great excuse to come back and visit us again.  We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: Literally, right off the 5.  Minutes to Dana Point, which you could see from the pool side of the hotel - and, the hotel offered a shuttle down to Dana Point Harbor.  The room was updated, spacious, and nicely appointed.  It had everything you could need for an extended stay.  The only complaint I had was having to pay for parking at this particular location.  I can't imagine too many people arrive by taxi - so, it is almost a given that you'll need to park a vehicle.  If this hotel were located in a downtown or more congested area, then I can understand the need to charge.  But, at a Residence Inn in a more suburban area, I found the extra charge to be a bit irritating.  All in all, I'd pick this hotel again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the San Juan Capistrano Dana Point Residence Inn. Thank you for the staying with us and for your kind words regarding our hotel. We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Summary: Well, aside from being right next to the 5 freeway (great for conveinience bad for noise)....this Residence hits the mark.  My wife and I ran away for an overnighter and used our free Marriott certificate here.  We had a studio unit on the third floor so no footsteps above us, it had a small kitchen, living area with an L shaped couch and king bed area.  All of the furniture looks custom made to fit perfectly for the room size.  It would be so nice and functional for a business trip.  They serve breakfast each day and three days weekly will provide a meal for it's guests.  The pool area is very nice with lots of great sunshine all day long.  The room was quiet and we enjoyed our stay and will return.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so looking to host your future stay in the area! The hotel is located in between the historic San Juan Capistrano and the scenic Dana Point. We are also just a few miles away from the beautiful Laguna Beach. As you mentioned - easy access to freeway which is perfect for our guests.  Have a wonderful rest of the year!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: My husband and some friends stayed here for a wedding in Dana Point. Easy access to downtown Dana Point and all the restaurants. Nice continental breakfast, although it got really busy at times and they were out of a lot of things at times. Rooms were good size and pretty clean, although our drains needed some attention. Pool area was nice as well as fire pit area. Staff was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel as an alternative to higher priced hotels right on the water. The only real gripe I would have to say that this hotel is located near train tracks, so there were a few times that the train could be heard during the evening and middle of the night, but mostly during the daytime.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Have a wonderful rest of the year!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: Our suite was on the second floor.  It's very nice, with flat screen TV, soft bed, beautiful furnishings and fully equipped kitchen.  I did not know about the kitchen, we should have brought things to cook.    There's free wifi and breakfast.  The pool area is beautiful, with patio seatings all over.  My favorite area is the fireplace outside.  There's also a tennis court, a putting green, and a jogging/walking trail.  There's a view of the surroundings by the pool.  Sadly, our room had the opposite view facing the street but the room made up for the view.    There's also another large fireplace in the lobby area.  DeShawn and his staff were great.  The person cooking/manning the breakfast is a saint.  There's a $12 free parking, but the free wifi made up that charge.  I'd
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! Rest assured that this will be shared with the team! We are so looking forward to host you this fall/winter. We are so pleased that you had fantastic time touring the historic downtown San Juan Capistrano. We are also less than 5 minutes away from the beautiful Dana Point Harbor!  Have a wonderful rest of the summer! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: This practically brand new all-suite property is perfect for families.  Huge suites w/ lots of space to relax and very modern and spacious kitchenette w/ a full fridge.  This is our first time staying at a RI and if all RIs are like this we will continue to stay in them.  Their complimentary self-serve buffet breakfast was ok, definitely not gourmet but good enough.  This property is very close to the harbor and a great location if you can't afford luxury accommodations or if you just need a room in Dana Point.  Yes, it's located in SJC but really really super close to Dana point.  There was ample parking even though it's $12/night and the pool was just okay.  However, the staff were very friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for a great feedback! Yes, we are strategically located in between two beautiful cities - the historic San Juan Capistrano and the scenic Dana Point! We are so pleased that you had a fantastic time!  We are so looking forward to host your future visits in the area.   Have a wonderful summer!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary Heading: The Best Marriot RI we have stayed in so far
Summary: I have stayed in several RI throughout my travels and they all have the same room set up and same amenities.  But I was taken back about the subtle but noticeable perks in this particular RI. Bathroom shower was, upscale. King bed was, comfortable. Pillow, just the right bit of sturdiness and softness for a good sleep. The lounging sofa was clean and comfortable. I actually had to use the desk this time to log in to work and it was very convenient. The hallways had a pleasant smell even during the time food was been served at breakfast area. Wifi was strong and Free!!Check in and check out was a freeze!Parking was a non issue, which was great. Overall, a great hotel to stay. We drove around the area and it was located near everything we needed. That is why I can't complaint to
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for a great feedback! It was a pleasure hosting your stay! So looking for another great visit soon!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: This hotel might stand at #2 best hotel I have ever stayed in, and I've been all over the country staying in Marriott hotels.  I say #2 because in our favorite hotel, the Residence Inn in Norfolk, Va., the chef comes out and asks people how they like the food and what he could add!  But everything else is spectacular.  Furnishings are great, breakfast room is huge and good looking, 3 Manager's nights per week (mini-dinners), two types of complimentary newspapers, big rooms, comfortable chairs and beds, huge desk to work on (we were in a 1-bedroom suite).  There were 3 dressers with 9 drawers total.  Of course the full refrigerator with freezer and microwave.  I'm ready to move in!  Drawbacks:  Only one--$12.00 per day parking fee.  Outrageous! (this isn't New York)
Manager Response: Hello! Awesome!!!! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! Rest assured that this will be shared with the team.  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers for the summer!  -Grace M.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a Good Price
Summary: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's a Residence Inn, so it has nice touches like free full breakfast, free wi-fi, all the rooms are suites with refrigerators, etc. Staff were all very friendly. A shout out to Colin who was kind enough to let us keep our surfboards in their meeting room overnight. The pool area is very nice - well and well appointed. The location is convenient to I5 and the PCH. You can be at Doheny State Beach Park in two minutes. The location is also convenient to Laguna Niguel (12 minutes awa) and San Clemente (10 minutes away). I highly recommend Residence Inn San Juan Capistrano.
Manager Response: Happy Summer! We are so pleased that you had a wonderful stay with us! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary Heading: Convenient and clean, but beware the trains
Summary: I stayed out here recently for work and it was pretty convenient to get to the Laguna Niguel area.  Plus, it's close to the water at Dana Point for a nice walk or run.  The rooms are clean and comfortable and the place seems to have very good upkeep.  Very close to the 5 Freeway.  Only complaint - the trains.   I know they can't help it, but this alone brings the rating down.   I mostly slept through the nights but the occasional late night train would wake me up...it can be very loud.   Just something to keep in mind in case you want earplugs.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the Residence Inn Dana Point San Juan Capistrano. Thank you for the kind words regarding our room cleanliness and upkeep. Our room attendants take great pride ensuring the room quality for our guest.   As for the train, I apologize that the train caused you a few sleepless nights. We are in the process of finding a long term solution for the noise.  If i may be of assistance or if you have additional feedback you would be willing to share, please don’t hesitate to contact me.  Sincerely, De'Andre Gipson Assistant General Manager

Summary: We recently needed to go to a wedding in San Clemente, CA. Whenever we are in this area, we always like to visit San Juan Capistrano (SJC) as well.  We were originally looking for a hotel closer to SJC but there are not many near the mission.  We found this Residence Inn and decided to try it and ended up liking it very much. It is what we call a traveler’s hotel, not a destination hotel as it is not at a particular destination (management may not agree). In fact, it sits at the junction of three major destinations in the area (San Juan Capistrano, Dana Point, and San Clemente) and is just off I-5. It is less than five minutes to each of these locations except maybe 10 minutes to the heart of San Clemente, on surface streets, which made it ideal for us.  The hotel is a typical
Manager Response: Happy Summer! Thank you for a great review! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: Had a chance to stay this past Friday, very nice hotel.  Very easy to get to, we had been visiting Laguna Beach.  Great staff, very busy for breakfast the next morning!  Staff was great at keeping breakfast items stocked.  We were on the side facing the auto dealer, so very little road or train noise.
Manager Response: Greetings! Happy summer! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: I stay at many Residence Inn and Marriott Properties when I travel for business and was unexpectedly surprised by this one. Updated and clean rooms and a pretty cool little outdoor area outside the breakfast lounge which included a fire pit and nice pool.  The cool surprise was the putting green which is a great way to share laughs with my employees after a long day. The beach is right down the street which I wish we could have utilized.  It is an extended stay hotel but we were only here for one night.  But with all the cool little things at this hotel, I would be more than comfortable to stay at least a week.  If you are in the area don't miss this one just because it is an extended stay hotel.  Clean comfortable and unique.
Manager Response: Cheers! We are so pleased that enjoyed our beautiful product! Yes, we are a custom built Residence Inn by Marriott hotel up here in the beautiful Dana Point & San Juan Capistrano area! The hotel is a perfect fit for both short term & extended stay guest!  We are so looking forward to host you/family back in the area!  Have a wonderful summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: My mother lives in nearby Dana Point and the whole family descended on the area for a wedding. We were lucky to find this hotel. Quiet, clean, pleasant staff, beautiful facilities, great food, etc. we heard horror stories about other accommodations family rented. We gloated. Everyone was jealous at our situation. I wish every hotel/motel staff and owner would come and see how things should be done.
Manager Response: Greetings! We are so pleased that you enjoyed our beautiful hotel and its amenities! We are so looking forward to host you back again in the beautiful San Juan Capistrano & Dana Point area!  Cheers!  -Grace M

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and great kitchen in studio suite
Summary: We enjoyed the spacious, clean and comfortable studio suite that has a modern kitchen that's fully equipped. They even provide grocery shopping service daily which we didn't try.  Definitely ask for a room in the center of the building on the top floor. Being in the center, you'd be further from either side of train or highway. I could hear some train noise but not affecting sleep. When I reserved the room, I asked for a quiet room. So when I found out we're assigned a room very close to elevator, I was anxious but it turned out it IS the quietest location of the building.  We stayed there for 10 nights and I could testify we really enjoyed our room and had good sleep for such a lengthy stay.  The breakfast and evening snacks are also very good.
Manager Response: Fantastic! Thank you for the wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future visits up here in the historic San Juan Capistrano and the scenic Dana Point area!  Cheers for a great summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: We stayed here five nights in July and found it very comfortable.  The bed was extremely soft and comfy as were the pillows.  I always look for a comfortable bed!  The room was spacious with a large computer desk and L shaped couch.  Small kitchenette with a dishwasher and microwave.  A fully cooked breakfast buffet was offered which was just ok but an added bonus we could take it outside to eat.  I would definitely stay here again.  The road noise was there but I personally did not mind and we did sleep with our windows open. It almost became like 'white noise'.
Manager Response: Hello! Fantastic! We are so pleased that you had an excellent stay with us!! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area.  Have a wonderful summer!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: I am Pt MR member... average hotel, hotel manager not friendly, and do not greet anyone, ditto for the day time staffs. Don't expect anything special for Pt member, I seriously doubt they know what Pt members are. Poor management. Stay here because of location. This is probably the worst RI i have ever stayed in terms of response to our request and complaints.  RI at main street, irvine much better, friendlier staff
Manager Response: Hello,  I am deeply sorry about your experience with us during your stay. Our goal is to deliver above and beyond service to all our guests. As our valued Platinum member - you have one of our highest priorities to ensure that you will have an exceptional service experience at the hotel.  I need to address this service issue - this is unacceptable. Rest assured that this will be address immediately with our service team.   Also, it will be great if you can email me more information on this regard that will help me research/address the issue. I can be reached via email at ri.snasj.gm@marriott.com. Please let me know the best time and number to call you.  Again, please accept our deep apology on this regard.  Have a wonderful holiday weekend!  Sincerely, -Grace M.
