Summary: Stayed June 14th had a wedding to go to@5pm our room wasn't ready at 3:30. Check in time not till 4 but we were starting to stress still had to get ready! Angie at the front desk upgraded our room so we would have time! Then they shuttled us to the wedding!! Everything went great we got to the wedding on time. Thank you Angie
Manager Response: Hello and happy summer! Thank you for this was wonderful feedback regarding our great service!  I am so pleased that my team is doing above and beyond to accommodate our guest needs especially during our high summer season. I am so glad Angie did above and beyond for you/family!  I am sure that the wedding that you attended was fantastic! We are so looking forward to host your future stay again in the area!  Cheers! Grace M

Summary: Very nice property. Nice rooms, nice common areas, and a great staff. The drawbacks are 2, like many hotels in this area it is very close to HWY 5 so ask for a room far away. The second drawback is the main parking lot has barely enough slots to park your car...if you arrive late you may have to park in an auxiliary lot.   I would still stay here again but check in earlier.
Manager Response: Hello and happy summer! It was a pleasure hosting your stay! Thank you for making us your choice when travelling up here in the historic San Juan Capistrano and the scenic Dana Point areas.   Thank you for your feedback on the parking lot and room layout. At any time, please feel to call or email us depending on availability on regards to the location of your room.  Thanks again for this wonderful note. We are so looking forward to host you again in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: Stayed at this motel last year for 3 weeks came back this year big difference in the way this motel has changed in the way that they like your business the manager not what you would expect the maids don't want to do their job ask for room to be cleaned all she did was made bed and didn't clean bathroom or leave coffee or soap or shampoo had to go to front desk and to top everything you have to pay 12 dollars a day for parking on top of the room rates
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for your feedback on regards to your stay with us last week. I am deeply sorry that there were areas during your stay that we could have done better. I will share your feedback with the team - rest assured that this will be address and accounted for on our end.   I wish that we had an opportunity to correct the issues during your stay. If you need to discuss this further, please feel free to reach out to me or De’Andre Gipson.  Thank you again for your feedback. Have a wonderful summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: This hotel was spotless.  I stayed in a studio with a King and there was plenty of room!  Clean room and linens...free breakfast was typical of other Marriotts I had stayed at and was perfectly fine.  The breakfast area was a little messy at times, but the hotel was full when I stayed there.  Although it was full, the room was quiet...couln't hear anything from the hall or neighboring rooms.  As other reviewers have said, the train sound is a bit of an issue during the day, but at night it wasn't a problem and my room overlooked the tracks, but I also had a beautiful ocean view!  Easy access to the freeway as well. Pool area was very pretty  All in all, I would definitely stay here again if I travel back to the area.
Manager Response: Hello! Happy Summer! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are proud of our beautiful product and service! I am so pleased that you had a fantastic time visiting the historic San Juan Capistrano and the breathtaking Dana Point area! Yes, the hotel is close to the train path, but majority of our guests seemed not to be bother by it. On a positive note, the hotel is in the process of working with the City of San Juan to create a long term solution for the train noise issue.  We are so looking forward to host any of your future stay in the area!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: Do not expect to get any sleep whats so ever.  You will be woken up several times a night to a very loud train horn (sounded like it was next to my head).  The room was lovely but only stay here if you want to get woken to a start several times throughout the night and morning.  I get that they can't control the very loud train horn but they should have warned me that it was going to be that noisy.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on regards to the train noise experience during your stay at the hotel. We will continue to find a long term solution for this with the City of San Juan. The train has to honk its horn when crossing the path near Camino Capistrano for public safety compliance.   Again, please accept apology on this regard. At any time, please fee free to reach out to me if you wish to further discuss this.  Have a wonderful summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: The Desk clerks are pleasant and helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean. Location is safe and a nice walking distance to the harbor. Breakfast was a hot and fresh start to a beautiful day! The only drawback is that there aren't any restaurants nearby. We were happy to walk 1.5 miles to the harbor but not everyone can do that
Manager Response: Thank you for a great feedback!!!! Great to know that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and our beautiful hotel!  We do have a shuttle that can drive you from/to the Dana Point Harbor. I apologize if this was not shared to you at check in.  I trust that you enjoyed Dana Point harbor and its restaurant selections. The harbor is beautiful!  Have a wonderful summer! So looking forward to host you again when you visit the historic San Juan Capistrano and the scenic Dana Point area!   Deeply appreciate your wonderful comments!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: This is a common design Residence Inn that is well maintained. We had the large king room, which we prefer since the walled units chops it up and makes the room look smaller. The breakfast and the Manager Reception was very nice. The bent over backwards to make the food for my limited diet. We will go back again. This is a "Gotta Go" kinda place.  IHG, Rube
Manager Response: Happy summer! Thank you for a wonderful feedback! We are so pleased that you enjoyed our beautiful hotel and amenities! The hotel is a custom built Residence Inn - perfect for business and leisure destination located at the historic San Juan Capistrano and the beautiful Dana Point!  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Cheers!  -Grace M.

Summary: This is a newer property that has some beautifully decorated public areas and clean, attractive, efficiently laid out rooms.  Each room has a full size refrigerator, a cooktop, microwave  and dishwasher in a kitchen area, a large desk, and other amenities.  The disadvantages: it's located at the intersection of two very busy streets and it's close enough to the train tracks so that traffic and train noise can be heard in the rooms.  We were at the west end of the hotel, farthest from the traffic, and we still found it irritating.  We had a reservation stating a 3 p.m. arrival, and at 5 our room wasn't ready and we had a half hour wait.  Desk staff was not very attentive.  On the other hand the complementary "enhanced" continental breakfast was above average. The hotel is a quick
Manager Response: Hello! Deeply appreciate your wonderful feedback about our breakfast, amenities and location. The hotel is a custom built Residence Inn located in the historic San Juan Capistrano and a mile away from the beautiful Dana Point. We are so pleased that you had a wonderful time at the hotel!  On regards to your feedback at the front desk - I apologize for the delay and lack of attentiveness on our end. Rest assured that this will be addressed and accounted for.  Have a wonderful summer! So looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  Best, -Grace M.

Summary Heading: Don't let the location fool you...
Summary: My family and I went away for a little staycation.  We've never been to this Residence Inn before but it was close to Dana Point/Laguna Beach/San Juan Capistrano so it was super convenient.  The hotel was well kept, the room spacious.  Full size fridge, stove top, microwave and dishwasher were in the room so we were able to have meals in the room if we wanted.  Free breakfast was awesome.  Not much selection but just enough to start our day!    If having a view is important, you might not like that it basically is the Costco, a trailer park, freeway, and car dealership.  That said, that wasn't a big deal to me.  You go out to the pool area, mini putting green, and basketball court and it was still like you were in another place.  The kids had a blast!  Great service, everyone
Manager Response: Hello! We are so pleased that your family enjoyed your visit at our beautiful hotel! Yes, we are a perfect fit for family/business visiting to see the beautiful Dana Point, historic San Juan Capistrano and Laguna Niguel area.  We are so looking forward to host your future stay!  Cheers for a great summer!  -Grace M.

Summary: First thing I noticed on the LONG walk to our room (poorly designed layout -one elevator bank to service such a spread out floorplan)was how dirty the carpet was in the hallway. Two requests over 4 days to vacuum it went unheeded. View of Costco parking lot, trailer park and train tracks. The LOUD whistle of trains all night and morning interrupted sleep. There was an underlying scent of mildew in the room. Tipped the housekeeper with a request for more hangers (only 4 in the closet) and a request to replace wine glasses were ignored...but the money was gone. The complimentary breakfast was not great. Messy kitchen, tables not wiped off, garbage overflowing. Yuck.  The place is busy...don't know why...competitors take note...there is an opportunity here...
Manager Response: Hello Nancy,  Thank you for your feedback. Rest assured that we will address the service/cleanliness issues that you shared. We apologize that we failed to meet your service expectations during your stay. Our team is deeply committed to service and guest satisfaction - we will continue to work on these feedbacks to better our current process.  Wishing you and yours a wonderful summer!   Sincerely, Grace M.

Summary: Wonderful, clean facility.   The suite was new, well appointed and modern.   If I were to detract a half of a star, it would be for the breakfast and early evening snack.   There were a lot of families there and there was not enough food at either meal.   They seemed to have only one person trying to service the food area and he was clearly overwhelmed.   You really cannot complain, since the food is free.   You can choose to be on the freeway, local road or railroad side.   I chose railroad and was only wakened once during the night.   I will stay again.
Manager Response: Hi Lynne,  Thank you for a wonderful feedback! We are so looking to host you future stay up here in the historic San Juan Capistrano and the beautiful Dana Point area! We are pleased that you enjoyed our amenities, spacious rooms and staff service.  Yes, we continue to review our staffing daily based on demand. Thank you for the feedback.  Have a wonderful summer!  Cheers! -Grace M.

Summary: I was impressed with the new generation of residence inn when I travel i try and stay at residence inn great food clean rooms and friendly staff. The only downfall is pay to park I wish places would just hide the fee by raising price of room a bit
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for a great feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!   Yes, we have a beautiful custom built Residence Inn by Marriott at the historic City of San Juan Capistrano and the beautiful Dana Point area. I am glad that you enjoyed our hotel and amenities.  Have a wonderful summer and we hope to see on your next trip!  Cheers! -Grace

Summary: The location of this hotel is convenient as far as access to freeway and not too far from the ocean.  However, it's not really in spot that offers great views.  The view out of our room was of the big Costco next door, with a little bit of the ocean behind that.   The rooms were clean, quite roomy, and nicely decorated.  The breakfast was one of the better I've experienced at a Marriott.  I especially enjoyed the blueberries.  Staff was friendly and they were accommodative as we arrived two hours before our official check-in time.  Only minor complaint would be that there was nobody at the front desk for check-in and check-out, so we had to wait for a bit on both occasions for somebody to show up.  Maybe a bell or something like that up at the desk could be useful so we would
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for this wonderful feedback! We are so pleased that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and other hotel amenities. We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the historic City of San Juan Capistrano and the beautiful Dana Point area.  I apologize that there was a delay in your service at the Front Desk. Rest assured that I will address this feedback with my team. Our Front desk service is 24 hours - 7 days a week. Again - our apologies.  Have a wonderful spring!!!!  Best, Grace M.

Summary: So the hotel has their own private parking, and yet they charge $12 dollars a day fee - absurd.  Their excuse to me was well we have beach nearby - bogus!   No of the other hotels in the area charge a parking fee.   Get rid of the fee, as you're not renting the space to park the cars!!!  And how else is someone getting to the property??? (Walking?)  Few other things - no dish soap, they give you 1 packet for dishwasher...OMG!  To funny, and this is suppose to be ...home away from home...The bathroom - you open the door and it almost hits the toilet.  Talk about cramped.    Other this room was clean and workable - TV channels have very few options - due to the new and dumb cable program for tvs...lol!
Manager Response: Hello!  I trust that you are having a fantastic week! Thank you again for your feedback on regards to your stay with us this month. I totally understand your frustration on our $12 parking fee - however, I just want to share that this is a competitive parking fee vs. other hotels in our market. On the missing amenities in the room - our apologies. Rest assured that this will be shared and addressed with our housekeeping team.  We are hopeful that you can give us another opportuniy to host any of your future stays in the area! Please feel free to reach out to me for any requests or assistance.  Have a wonderful week!  Sincerely, - Grace M.

Summary: My husband, two daughters (ages 4 and 5) stayed at this hotel for one night and had a good experience overall.  • Rooms are nice... we had a corner suite with a separate bedroom so when our girls fell asleep, we were able to hang out in the main living room area and relax without bothering them. • Our room was right above the basketball courts, pool, etc... but we didn't mind the noise at all. • Hotel seems to be fairly new so it's clean and well maintained. • Free breakfast was awesome • Free WiFi  • Driving distance to town center, mission, local beaches • Our room had a small kitchenette with a stove, microwave, sink, fridge, silverware, and glassware.  It was perfect for a quick one night getaway!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for a great feedback!!!! We are so pleased that your family had a wonderful weekend with us! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in Dana Point/San Juan Capistrano area!  Best to you and yours, -Grace M.

Summary Heading: All nice except the pit bull and the assitant manager's response
Summary: I booked a room for my wife and daughter at Residence Inn San Juan Capistrano. The only (terrible) problem was the presence of a huge pit bull next door. Evidently they have no policy restricting the size or kind of pet that stays there and they clearly do not attempt to keep such "pets" in an area and other "petless" guests in another area. When I called Marriott, they forwarded the complain to the hotel. I then received a generic you-are-a-valuable-guest email from the Assistant General Manager, Jim.... No reference to the issue, no answer to my question, no explanation of policy..... Nothing. Just another cheesy response. I expected better from Marriott. WOULD NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.
Manager Response: Hi Sam,  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to speak with you over the phone regarding this issue. Again, we are deeply sorry for all the inconvenience that this issue had caused you. Thank you for your understanding.  We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area.   Have a wonderful week!  Best, -Grace M.

Summary: I stayed here for a week with my husband, two kids, and our au pair. The two bedroom/two bathroom suite w/ sofabed not only made our stay comfortable, it was a much better value than paying for multiple rooms and being separated by a hallway a more traditional hotel. I agree with the reviews that the hotel is understaffed - particularly at the breakfast bar - on the other hand, the hotel was spotless outside as well as inside (a major feat for the number of dogs who were staying there. The employees we interacted with were polite, warm and welcoming and did their best to accomdate all of our needs. The view isn't great, but the rooms were quiet (despite all of the dogs and even though it's right next to the highway), and the location is really convenient. Aside from staffing, my
Manager Response: Hello! It was a pleasure hosting your stay! We are so looking forward to host your future visits in the area! Please feel free to reach out to me/team if there is anything that we can do for your next trip!  Cheers and have a great 2014!!!!  Best, Grace M.

Summary: Stayed here for ten days at the end of October and early November. Standard Residence Inn with a suite with a kitchenette. Breakfast everyday and manger's special three nights a week. $12 per day parking fee! That was a bit of a shock.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for the wonderful feedback! We are so looking forward to host your future stay in the area!  On regards to the parking charge, we will continue to proactively communicate this to our guests at check in. I do apologize if this was not shared with you during the check in process.  Have a wonderful holiday!  Cheers!  Grace M.

Summary: Much has been said in prior reviews about how understaffed this Residence and I saw that for myself. My colleague and I arrived at 4 p.m. on a Friday afternoon in October. There was a long line at reception and only one person at the front desk. He was like a chicken with its head cut off, running between the two work stations, answering the phones, and trying to manage the growing number of people coming to talk to him. These included a large number of wedding guests. After a half hour of waiting, my colleague and I decided to leave to grab dinner, as we had been traveling for the past 12 hours from the East Coast then had gone straight to work before coming to the hotel. When we returned two hours later, the number of guests at reception did not seem to have lessened; there
Manager Response: Hello! I do apologize for the delay of the response - we were in the process of doing a transition. Thank you for your feedback and I do understand your frustration. Rest assured that the issues were shared and was addressed with my team.  If you need to personally speak with me on this regard - please feel free to call me at 949-4433600 ext. 461.   Sincerely,  Grace M.

Summary Heading: My Stay @ Residence Inn San Juan Capistrano
Summary: Thanks for the hospitality! It was very much appreciated! All employees were well trained and had great customer service skills! The accommodations were wonderful! Made my Business trip most enjoyable! Keep up the good work!!!! How wonderful it is to see so many "Team Players" in one location! Will definitely look forward to my next trip to CA.  Regards, Penny Shores (Minnesota)
Manager Response: Thank you! It was a pleasure hosting your stay! We are so looking forward to host your future visits in the area!  Have a wonderful holiday!  Cheers!  Grace M.

Summary Heading: Great location and clean hotel, but...
Summary: My family and I were attending a wedding at the Ritz Carlton Dana Point on Labor Day weekend, but there was no way we were going to shell out $$$ to stay at the Ritz.    Pros:  This hotel has a great location.  It is easy to get onto the PCH and hit up the beach and it's also very close to a grocery store and the historic downtown mission is just a couple miles away.  The hotel is very clean and offers complimentary wifi, free breakfast, and kitchenette like other Residence Inns.  When I booked my room, only studios were available.  At check-in, I was hoping to upgrade from a studio to a suite so we could have a separate bedroom.  Before I made my reservation, I had read so many reviews that mentioned Jennifer at the front desk. Assuming there is only one Jennifer working there,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but oh the trains...
Summary: When we checked in, we noticed the hotel was extremely clean, which we thought was fantastic.  The room did not disappoint in that regard, very clean and pleasant.  Nice kitchenette, everything worked well.  The front desk clerk when we checked in was very friendly, mentioning the dinner they offered that night as well as what time the breakfast was available in the morning.  The desk clerk when we checked out (early to catch the boat to Catalina) was less than enthusiastic- did not even ask how our stay was!  The only troubling thing about the whole stay was the trains.  The hotel is next to the Amtrak tracks, and as such you get the frequent trips of the Amtrak Surfliner and Coastliner.  Those are not bad, as they go by quickly with only a quick horn blast.  However, late at
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had read other reviews of the this hotel before staying.  We were concerned about the front desk customer service and timely room cleaning.  We decided to stay anyway as most reviews were positive.  Laura at the front desk was superb.  She was attentive to our needs and made sure we had a great stay.  Also Amy (a manager) was very accommodating.  Rooms were cleaned timely and well.  The beds were very comfortable.  We stayed on the freeway side of the property and freeway noise was very muted and did not affect our sleep.    Only suggestion would be a poolside bar!!!
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to post your comments about your recent stay. To hear from our guests how impressed they are with the staff is always encouraging. Laura has been with us from the beginning and has truly been a wonderful associate to have on the team.  Your comments have been shared with Laura and the entire staff. We look forward to having you stay with us in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Rooms - front desk customer service needs work
Summary: My first impression of this hotel was - you have to be kidding me.  I (like another reviewer) chose this hotel because of my Marriott status.  I get there at 2:00 in the afternoon and ask for a room with 2 beds - no they don't have one.  Okay - how about a suite as I am Platinum - no, don't have that either.
